descripction: Bora Bora is a small South Pacific island northwest of Tahiti in French Polynesia.
The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the Yamuna river in the Indian city of Agra.
Balinese culture is a mix of Balinese Hindu-Buddhist religion and Balinese customs.
Angkor Wat is a temple complex in Cambodia and the largest religious monument in the world.
Machu Picchu is a 15th-century Inca citadel located in the Eastern Cordillera of southern Peru.
Petra is a famous archaeological site in Jordan's southwestern desert. Dating to around 300 B.C.
The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications northern borders of China to protect the Chinese states and empires.
The Colosseum is an oval amphitheater in the center of the city of Rome, Italy, just east of the Roman Forum.
The Sydney Opera House is a multi-venue performing arts center at Sydney Harbour in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia.
